channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: QUILL: Quotation Generation Enhancement of Large Language Models
item.description: To improve the LLMs' quotation generation abilities, we construct a bilingual knowledge base that is broad in scope and rich in dimensions, containing up to 32, 022 quotes.

item.title: Reconsidering the Performance of GAE in Link Prediction
item.description: Various graph neural networks (GNNs) with advanced training techniques and model designs have been proposed for link prediction tasks.

item.title: EXPLORA: Efficient Exemplar Subset Selection for Complex Reasoning
item.description: Answering reasoning-based complex questions over text and hybrid sources, including tables, is a challenging task.

item.title: AMNCutter: Affinity-Attention-Guided Multi-View Normalized Cutter for Unsupervised Surgical Instrument Segmentation
item.description: Recent unsupervised surgical instrument segmentation (USIS) methods primarily rely on pseudo-labels derived from low-level features such as color and optical flow, but these methods show limited effectiveness and generalizability in complex and unseen endoscopic scenarios.

item.title: Optimal Defenses Against Gradient Reconstruction Attacks
item.description: Federated Learning (FL) is designed to prevent data leakage through collaborative model training without centralized data storage.

item.title: Policy Aggregation
item.description: We consider the challenge of AI value alignment with multiple individuals that have different reward functions and optimal policies in an underlying Markov decision process.

item.title: Structure Consistent Gaussian Splatting with Matching Prior for Few-shot Novel View Synthesis
item.description: In this paper, we propose SCGaussian, a Structure Consistent Gaussian Splatting method using matching priors to learn 3D consistent scene structure.

item.title: RaVL: Discovering and Mitigating Spurious Correlations in Fine-Tuned Vision-Language Models
item.description: Fine-tuned vision-language models (VLMs) often capture spurious correlations between image features and textual attributes, resulting in degraded zero-shot performance at test time.

item.title: Generalize or Detect? Towards Robust Semantic Segmentation Under Multiple Distribution Shifts
item.description: We validate the effectiveness of our method across benchmarks featuring both semantic and domain shifts.

item.title: LCP-Fusion: A Neural Implicit SLAM with Enhanced Local Constraints and Computable Prior
item.description: In this paper, we present LCP-Fusion, a neural implicit SLAM system with enhanced local constraints and computable prior, which takes the sparse voxel octree structure containing feature grids and SDF priors as hybrid scene representation, enabling the scalability and robustness during mapping and tracking.

item.title: Evaluating Moral Beliefs across LLMs through a Pluralistic Framework
item.description: Additionally, through moral debates, we investigate the firmness of these models to their moral choices.

item.title: A Collaborative Content Moderation Framework for Toxicity Detection based on Conformalized Estimates of Annotation Disagreement
item.description: Content moderation typically combines the efforts of human moderators and machine learning models. However, these systems often rely on data where significant disagreement occurs during moderation, reflecting the subjective nature of toxicity perception. Rather than dismissing this disagreement as noise, we interpret it as a valuable signal that highlights the inherent ambiguity of the content, an insight missed when only the majority label is considered. In this work, we introduce a novel content moderation framework that emphasizes the importance of capturing annotation disagreement.

item.title: Efficient Fourier Filtering Network with Contrastive Learning for UAV-based Unaligned Bi-modal Salient Object Detection
item.description: Extensive experiments on the UAV RGB-T 2400 and three weakly aligned datasets demonstrate that AlignSal achieves both real-time inference speed and better performance and generalizability compared to sixteen state-of-the-art BSOD models across most evaluation metrics.

item.title: AdaSociety: An Adaptive Environment with Social Structures for Multi-Agent Decision-Making
item.description: As agents progress, the environment adaptively generates new tasks with social structures for agents to undertake.

item.title: Multi3Hate: Multimodal, Multilingual, and Multicultural Hate Speech Detection with Vision-Language Models
item.description: To investigate this, we create the first multimodal and multilingual parallel hate speech dataset, annotated by a multicultural set of annotators, called Multi3Hate.

item.title: ROBIN: Robust and Invisible Watermarks for Diffusion Models with Adversarial Optimization
item.description: They empirically inject a watermark that is both invisible and robust and passively achieve concealment by limiting the strength of the watermark, thus reducing the robustness.

item.title: Lexicalization Is All You Need: Examining the Impact of Lexical Knowledge in a Compositional QALD System
item.description: We argue in this paper that lexicalization, that is explicit knowledge about the potential interpretations of a word with respect to the given vocabulary, significantly eases the task and increases the performance of QA systems.

item.title: Pseudo-labeling with Keyword Refining for Few-Supervised Video Captioning
item.description: Meanwhile, the former employs the repetition penalized sampling to encourage the model to yield concise pseudo-labeled sentences with less repetition, and selects the most relevant sentences upon a pretrained video-text model.

item.title: MEG: Medical Knowledge-Augmented Large Language Models for Question Answering
item.description: We evaluate our method on four popular medical multiple-choice datasets and show that LLMs greatly benefit from the factual grounding provided by knowledge graph embeddings.

item.title: Number Cookbook: Number Understanding of Language Models and How to Improve It
item.description: We also finetune practical-scale LLMs on our proposed NUPA tasks and find that 1) naive finetuning can improve NUPA a lot on many but not all tasks, and 2) surprisingly, techniques designed to enhance NUPA prove ineffective for finetuning pretrained models.

item.title: Beyond Model Adaptation at Test Time: A Survey
item.description: Machine learning algorithms have achieved remarkable success across various disciplines, use cases and applications, under the prevailing assumption that training and test samples are drawn from the same distribution.

item.title: Touchstone Benchmark: Are We on the Right Way for Evaluating AI Algorithms for Medical Segmentation?
item.description: We are committed to expanding this benchmark to encourage more innovation of AI algorithms for the medical domain.

item.title: HRDecoder: High-Resolution Decoder Network for Fundus Image Lesion Segmentation
item.description: Our method effectively improves the overall segmentation accuracy of fundus lesions while consuming reasonable memory and computational overhead, and maintaining satisfying inference speed.

item.title: SA3DIP: Segment Any 3D Instance with Potential 3D Priors
item.description: Thus, we present ScanNetV2-INS with complete ground truth labels and supplement additional instances for 3D class-agnostic instance segmentation.

item.title: Automatic doubly robust inference for linear functionals via calibrated debiased machine learning
item.description: For learning such estimands, in this work, we propose novel debiased machine learning estimators that are doubly robust asymptotically linear, thus providing not only doubly robust consistency but also facilitating doubly robust inference (e. g., confidence intervals and hypothesis tests).

item.title: Game Plot Design with an LLM-powered Assistant: An Empirical Study with Game Designers
item.description: We introduce GamePlot, an LLM-powered assistant that supports game designers in crafting immersive narratives for turn-based games, and allows them to test these games through a collaborative game play and refine the plot throughout the process.

item.title: V-DPO: Mitigating Hallucination in Large Vision Language Models via Vision-Guided Direct Preference Optimization
item.description: Recent research indicates that the over-reliance on the Large Language Model (LLM) backbone, as one cause of the LVLM hallucination, inherently introduces bias from language priors, leading to insufficient context attention to the visual inputs.

item.title: Lost in Context: The Influence of Context on Feature Attribution Methods for Object Recognition
item.description: This study investigates how context manipulation influences both model accuracy and feature attribution, providing insights into the reliance of object recognition models on contextual information as understood through the lens of feature attribution methods.

item.title: SynthSet: Generative Diffusion Model for Semantic Segmentation in Precision Agriculture
item.description: This paper introduces a methodology for generating synthetic annotated data to address data scarcity in semantic segmentation tasks within the precision agriculture domain.

item.title: Correlation of Object Detection Performance with Visual Saliency and Depth Estimation
item.description: As object detection techniques continue to evolve, understanding their relationships with complementary visual tasks becomes crucial for optimising model architectures and computational resources.

item.title: Membership Inference Attacks against Large Vision-Language Models
item.description: Large vision-language models (VLLMs) exhibit promising capabilities for processing multi-modal tasks across various application scenarios.

item.title: ADOPT: Modified Adam Can Converge with Any $Î²_2$ with the Optimal Rate
item.description: Adam is one of the most popular optimization algorithms in deep learning.

item.title: The Unreasonable Effectiveness of LLMs for Query Optimization
item.description: Recent work in database query optimization has used complex machine learning strategies, such as customized reinforcement learning schemes.

item.title: SMoA: Improving Multi-agent Large Language Models with Sparse Mixture-of-Agents
item.description: While multi-agent systems have been shown to significantly enhance the performance of Large Language Models (LLMs) across various tasks and applications, the dense interaction between scaling agents potentially hampers their efficiency and diversity.

item.title: DDFAV: Remote Sensing Large Vision Language Models Dataset and Evaluation Benchmark
item.description: Next, a training instruction set is produced based on some high-quality remote sensing images selected from the proposed dataset.

item.title: LiVOS: Light Video Object Segmentation with Gated Linear Matching
item.description: Semi-supervised video object segmentation (VOS) has been largely driven by space-time memory (STM) networks, which store past frame features in a spatiotemporal memory to segment the current frame via softmax attention.

item.title: Pathway-Guided Optimization of Deep Generative Molecular Design Models for Cancer Therapy
item.description: To demonstrate the potential of our proposed approach, we show how a pharmacodynamic model, assessing the therapeutic efficacy of a drug-like small molecule by predicting how it modulates a cancer pathway, can be incorporated for effective LSO of data-driven models for GMD.

item.title: Textual Aesthetics in Large Language Models
item.description: Image aesthetics is a crucial metric in the field of image generation.

item.title: Dissecting the Failure of Invariant Learning on Graphs
item.description: Enhancing node-level Out-Of-Distribution (OOD) generalization on graphs remains a crucial area of research.

item.title: Test-Time Dynamic Image Fusion
item.description: The decomposed components represent the effective information from the source data, thus the gap between them reflects the Relative Dominability (RD) of the uni-source data in constructing the fusion image.

item.title: Self-Calibrated Tuning of Vision-Language Models for Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: Out-of-distribution (OOD) detection is crucial for deploying reliable machine learning models in open-world applications.

item.title: A Deep-Based Approach for Multi-Descriptor Feature Extraction: Applications on SAR Image Registration
item.description: To address the challenges of SAR images, we utilize the R2D2 network and propose a training scheme specifically tailored for these images.

item.title: Unleashing the power of novel conditional generative approaches for new materials discovery
item.description: For a very long time, computational approaches to the design of new materials have relied on an iterative process of finding a candidate material and modeling its properties.

item.title: DA-MoE: Addressing Depth-Sensitivity in Graph-Level Analysis through Mixture of Experts
item.description: Empirically, fewer layers are sufficient for message passing in smaller graphs, while larger graphs typically require deeper networks to capture long-range dependencies and global features.

item.title: Grounding Natural Language to SQL Translation with Data-Based Self-Explanations
item.description: Natural Language Interfaces for Databases empower non-technical users to interact with data using natural language (NL).

item.title: Sparse Reconstruction of Wavefronts using an Over-Complete Phase Dictionary
item.description: The Zernike basis efficiently represents common optical aberrations but struggles with complex or non-standard wavefronts such as optical vortices, Bessel beams, or wavefronts with sharp discontinuities.

item.title: Privacy-Preserving Graph-Based Machine Learning with Fully Homomorphic Encryption for Collaborative Anti-Money Laundering
item.description: Combating money laundering has become increasingly complex with the rise of cybercrime and digitalization of financial transactions.

item.title: A Machine Learning Approach for the Efficient Estimation of Ground-Level Air Temperature in Urban Areas
item.description: Based on the obtained results, deep neural networks are confirmed to be faster and less computationally expensive alternative for ground-level air temperature compared to numerical models.

item.title: Time-Causal VAE: Robust Financial Time Series Generator
item.description: We build a time-causal variational autoencoder (TC-VAE) for robust generation of financial time series data.

item.title: Continual Audio-Visual Sound Separation
item.description: The task is inherently challenging as our models must not only effectively utilize information from both modalities in current tasks but also preserve their cross-modal association in old tasks to mitigate catastrophic forgetting during audio-visual continual learning.
